intro: Hiptage saigonensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese hiptage, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in clusters along the branches.
